data.title: The top 10 best American tennis players of all time: Ranked list
data.meta_description: Most of the former and best American tennis players have left behind a record that will take a lot of talent and determination to break. These are the best
data.text:
Picking and ranking the best American tennis players of all time is no walk in the park since the country has a large pool of talent to choose from. It could be at the top in producing the best tennis players in the world who, in turn, have set high standards for future generations to admire and strive for.

The first game in the country was held in 1881 at Newport, Rhode Island, and was only open for men who competed in singles, which was contrary to modern-day tennis. Over the years, the sport has undergone some changes, and today, both men and women participate in either singles or doubles.

Top 10 best American tennis players of all time

An athlete's performance and victories in various Grand Slam tournaments are vital to be considered the best in tennis. With that in mind, here is a list of the top 10 best American tennis players of all time.

Who has the most assists in Premier League history?

Football

10. Arthur Ashe

Full name: Arthur Robert Ashe Jr

Date of birth: 10 July 1943

Age: Passed at 49 years of age

Place of birth: Richmond, Virginia, USA

Ashe is one of the best African American tennis players in history. He won the first US Open in 1968 despite many barriers and stereotypes. Consequently, he became the first black tennis player to join the US Davis Cup team and win a Grand Slam title.

9. Althea Gibson

Full name: Althea Neale Gibson

Date of birth: 25 August 1927

Age: Died at 76 years old

Place of birth: Clarendon County, South Carolina, USA

At the ninth position sits Althea Gibson, who was the complete tennis player of the 1960s in the women's category. She had a lot on her plate since racism was widely spread, especially in the sports industry and the general public.

Ranking! Who are 20 of the most Influential NBA players of this decade?

NBA

Despite the challenges, she achieved immense success and has since become a source of inspiration to young talents. Althea was the first black player to win a Grand Slam.

8. Venus Williams

Full name: Venus Ebony Starr Williams

Date of birth: 17 June 1980

Age: 42 years (as of April 2023)

Place of birth: Lynwood, California, USA

Venus is one of the best American female tennis players of all time next to her sister, Serena. She is the only athlete in the sport that has won medals in 4 different Summer Olympics Games and has been dominating the women's tennis world for around two decades.

7. John McEnroe

Full name: John Patrick McEnroe Jr

Date of birth: 16 February 1959

Age: 64 years (as of April 2023)

Place of birth: Wiesbaden, West Germany, Germany

John is one of the best American tennis players, once ranked the World's No. 1 due to his silken skills at the net. He won several titles, including 9 Grand Slams men's doubles and seven singles, and ended his career with 77 ATP singles.

Top 20 most underrated footballers of all time: who are they?

Football

The renowned legend was known for his volleying ability and accurate shot-making skills, which put his rivals on their heels, thus giving them a hard time returning his balls.

6. Andre Agassi

Full name: Andre Kirk Agassi

Date of birth: 29 April 1970

Age: 52 years (as of April 2023)

Place of birth: Las Vegas, Nevada, USA

Among the best American tennis players in the 90s sits Andre Agassi, a former World number one. He was known for his nearly perfect returns, which experts and players deemed the best in the game's history. Additionally, Agassi is the only man to achieve a Career Super Slam, which in simple terms, means that he won all 4 Grand Slams.

5. Bill Tilden

Full name: William Tatem Tilden II

Date of birth: 10 February 1893

Age: Died at 60 years old

Place of birth: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA

15 of the most beautiful female golfers in the world right now

Golf

The legendary 'Big Bill' was the first American tennis player to take home the Wimbledon Championships title. He is widely known for his efforts to reach 10 Wimbledon finals and for being the first to win 10 Grand Slams singles titles. For six consecutive years, 1920-1925, Tilden was ranked number one globally.

4. Billie Jean King

Full name: Billie Jean King

Date of birth: 22 November 1943

Age: 79 years (as of April 2023)

Place of birth: Long Beach, California, USA

King was one of the best American tennis players in history and was widely known for her swiftness and exemplary backhand technique. During the 60s and the 70s, she participated in the singles and doubles tournaments, and in her career, she bagged 39 Grand Slam titles.

She was on the frontlines of forming the Women's Tennis Association in 1973, and in 1987, she was inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

Who is the best badminton player in the world right now? A top 10 list

Other Sports

3. Pete Sampras

Full name: Petros "Pete" Sampras

Date of birth: 12 August 1971

Age: 51 years (as of April 2023)

Place of birth: Washington DC, USA

Sampras is one of the best American tennis players of all time. Known for his fast serves, the legendary athlete won 14 Grand Slams titles in 12 years. He was ranked in the world's position for about 286 weeks. In addition, his rivalry with Agassi made them the best American tennis players in history.

2. Chris Evert

Full name: Christine Marie Evert

Date of birth: 21 December 1954

Age: 68 years (as of April 2023)

Place of birth: Fort Lauderdale, Florida, USA

Chris ranks as one of the best American female tennis players of all time, with a winning percentage of 89.97% in singles, the highest among both genders. With 31 appearances, she is the record holder for the most Grand Slam finals, winning 18 of them in 13 consecutive years.

The 10 best female rugby players currently: Find out who is the best

Rugby

1. Serena Williams

She rose to stardom in the late 90s as a teenager and became the only woman in history to win the Grand Slam singles titles in 3 different decades. Additionally, she is the most-paid athlete in the sport with over 80 million career earnings.

Full name: Serena Jameka Williams

Date of birth: 26 September 1981

Age: 41 years (as of April 2023)

Place of birth: Saginaw, Michigan, USA

Who is the greatest American tennis player of all time?

At the top of the list is Serena Williams, considered the greatest in the sport's history. She and her sister Venus are among the current best American tennis players.

Who is the most successful male American tennis player?

With 16 titles and a world ranking of number eight, John Isner is the most successful active American tennis player.

Who is the American former World 1 tennis player?

Who is the best gymnast in the world? A ranked top 10 list

Athletics

Having won the 2003 US Open tournament, Andrew Stephen Roddick is a former American world No. 1 athlete.

Who is the all-time king of tennis?

The GOAT, Roger Federer is widely known as the all-time king of tennis. To his name, he has bagged 20 Grand Slam titles, a record that has only been surpassed by two individuals, Novak Djokovic, and Rafael Nadal.

Most former best American tennis players have left behind a record that will take a lot of talent and determination to break. On the other hand, the United States of America has won more Grand Slams than any other country. Throughout the years, it has welcomed players from all corners to participate in the US Open and, in doing so, nurtured young talents who will take up the mantle in the future.

Other Sports

Sports Brief has compiled a list of the best F1 commentators in the world as of 2023. Formula One is one of the most viewed sports in the world right now, and like other sports like soccer, it has one of the best commentaries a fan can ask for.

F1 commentators mainly give details and thoughts to the fans explaining what is happening on the racetracks. To learn more about the best F1 commentators in the world, click on the link above.
